str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A store-house for precious things; hence: a treasure, a store. From tithemi; a deposit, i.e. Wealth.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.
And, even, also, namely.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.
